materials.name: Wood material (or Paper Product)
materials.notes: Orange to bright yellow flame, burns quickly, carbon-based combustion - use CO2 or water

materials.name: Wood Materials
materials.notes: Yellow-orange flame with blue base, hardwood burns steadier than softwood, organic material - use water or CO2

materials.name: Natural Fibers
materials.notes: Yellow flame, cotton burns fast, wool self-extinguishes, natural fiber - use water or CO2

materials.name: Synthetic Fibers
materials.notes: Orange flame with black smoke, melts and drips, synthetic material - use CO2

materials.name: Plastic Materials
materials.notes: Blue to orange flame variations, melts and drips, synthetic material - use CO2

materials.name: Foam Materials
materials.notes: Orange to pink flame with heavy black smoke, rapid spread, synthetic foam - use CO2

materials.name: Wax Materials
materials.notes: Steady yellow flame with blue base, natural wax burns cleaner than synthetic, organic wax - use CO2 or water

materials.name: Alcohol/Ethanol/Butane-Based Products
materials.notes: Pale blue flame, nearly invisible in daylight, higher alcohol content = paler flame, use CO2 or water spray

materials.name: Rubber Materials
materials.notes: Orange to pink flame with black smoke, natural rubber has sulfur odor, synthetic varies, use CO2 or foam

materials.name: Carpet Materials
materials.notes: Wool = yellow self-extinguishing flame, synthetic = orange melting flame - wool use water, synthetic use CO2

materials.name: Electrical Components
materials.notes: Green from copper wiring, blue from plastic insulation, never use water on live circuits

materials.name: Adhesive Materials
materials.notes: Paper-based = orange flame, plastic-based = blue flame, use appropriate extinguisher for base material

materials.name: Organic Waste
materials.notes: Bright yellow flame, dry organic burns faster than moist, carbon-based material - use water

materials.name: Food Products
materials.notes: Sugar = orange flame, starch = yellow flame, varies by composition, organic material - use water or CO2

materials.name: Spray Products
materials.notes: Blue flame from propellant, brief intense burn, use CO2

materials.name: Composite Materials
materials.notes: Fiberglass = orange from resin, vinyl = green tinge, use extinguisher for dominant material

materials.name: Liquid Fuels
materials.notes: Light fuels = blue flame, heavy fuels = orange with smoke, petroleum-based - use foam or CO2, never water

materials.name: Metal Objects
materials.notes: Iron = orange sparks, copper = green flame, requires very high temperature - use sand or Class D powder

materials.name: Chemical Products
materials.notes: Solvents typically blue, cleaners may be orange, check product label for specific guidance
